conclusion: Determine the refractive index using Snell's Law and critical angle.
The semicircular object has a radius R; light is incident at point C, which is (sqrt(3)/3)R from point O.
Critical angle concept: total internal reflection occurs if light enters at an angle greater than the critical angle.
Critical angle C is given by sin C = 1/n.
Consider right triangle OCB; use Pythagorean theorem: OB^2 + OC^2 = BC^2.
Substitute OC = (sqrt(3)/3)R and OB = R to find BC = 2R/sqrt(3).
Calculate angle C using sin C = OC/BC = 1/2.
Determine refractive index using n = 1/sin C; given sin C = 1/2, n = 2.
The refractive index n of the transparent object is 2.
